file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-43-05-04 - MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION LIGHTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION LIGHTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the main/standby rear navigation lights. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION ALL 33-43-05-000-801-A LIGHT LAMPS - REMOVAL MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION ALL 33-43-05-400-801-A LIGHT LAMPS - INSTALLATION MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION ALL 33-43-05-000-802-A LIGHT ASSEMBLIES - REMOVAL MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION ALL 33-43-05-400-802-A LIGHT ASSEMBLIES - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-43-05 Page 1 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-43-05-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION LIGHT LAMPS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the main/standby rear navigation light lamps. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 55-36-01-000-801-A/400 TAIL-BOOM LIGHT LENS - REMOVAL RUBBER VIBRATION ISOLATION MOUNTS - VISUAL AMM TASK 55-36-03-200-801-A/600 INSPECTION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Tail boom I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the NAV switch, on the overhead panel, is set to the OFF position. (2) Put a DO-NOT-OPERATE tag on the NAV switch. (3) Remove the tail boom lens ( AMM TASK 55-36-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) For aircraft without standby tail navigation lights, remove the main rear navigation light lamps as follows (Figure 401): (a) Remove the two screws (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-43-05 Page 2 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Remove the lens retainer (3). (c) Remove the lens (2). (d) Remove the lamp (1). (e) For aircraft with rubber vibration-isolation mounts installed, do a visual inspection on these components (AMM TASK 55-36-03-200-801-A/600). (2) For aircraft with standby tail navigation lights, remove the main/standby rear navigation light lamps as follows (Figure 402): (a) Remove the two screws (3). (b) Remove the baffle (2). CAUTION: DO NOT TOUCH THE LAMP DIRECTLY WITH FINGER TIP. THIS WILL DAMAGE THE LAMP. REMOVE GREASE OR FINGERPRINTS WITH A CLEANING CLOTH SOAKED IN THE CORRECT DEGREASER. (c) Carefully push the lamp (1) and turn it counterclockwise to unlock it. (d) Remove the lamp (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-43-05 Page 3 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITHOUT STANDBY TAIL NAVIGATION LIGHTS Main Rear Navigation Light Lamps - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 321 B DET. A 1. LAMP 2. LENS 3. LENS RETAINER DET. B 4. SCREW (2) 145AMM330093.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-43-05 Page 4 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH STANDBY TAIL NAVIGATION LIGHTS Main/Standby Rear Navigation Light Lamps - Removal/Installation Figure 402 A ZONE 321 B REAR WHITE NAVIGATION LIGHT MAIN SYSTEM REAR WHITE NAVIGATION LIGHT STANDBY SYSTEM DET. A B 2. BAFFLE 1. LAMP 3. SCREW (2) DET. B (TYPICAL) 145AMM330483.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-43-05 Page 5 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-43-05-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION LIGHT LAMPS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the main/standby rear navigation light lamps. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-43-00-700-801-A/500 NAVIGATION LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 55-36-01-400-801-A/400 TAIL-BOOM LIGHT LENS - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Tail boom I. Installation SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) For aircraft without standby tail navigation lights, install main rear navigation light lamps as follows (Figure 401): (a) Install the lamp (1). (b) Install the lens (2). (c) Install the lens retainer (3). (d) Tighten the two washers (4). (2) For aircraft with standby tail navigation lights, install main/standby rear navigation light lamps as follows (Figure 402): EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-43-05 Page 6 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CAUTION: DO NOT TOUCH THE LAMP DIRECTLY WITH FINGER TIP. THIS WILL DAMAGE THE LAMP. REMOVE GREASE OR FINGERPRINTS WITH A CLEANING CLOTH SOAKED IN CORRECT DEGREASER. (a) Put the lamp in its installation position. (b) Carefully push the lamp (1) and turn it clockwise to lock it. (c) Install the baffle (2). (d) Tighten the two washers (3). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the DO-NOT-OPERATE tag from the NAV switch. (2) Do the operational test of the main/standby rear navigation lights installed ( AMM TASK 33-43-00-700-801-A/500). (3) Install the tail boom lens ( AMM TASK 55-36-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-43-05 Page 7 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-43-05-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 4. MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION LIGHT ASSEMBLIES - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the main/standby rear navigation light assemblies. (2) The main/standby rear navigation light assemblies are installed in the tail boom. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 55-36-01-000-801-A/400 TAIL-BOOM LIGHT LENS - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Tail boom I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Make sure that the NAV switch, on the overhead panel, is set to the OFF position. (3) Put a DO-NOT-OPERATE tag on the NAV switch. (4) Remove the tail-boom light lens ( AMM TASK 55-36-01-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 403) (Figure 404) (Figure 405) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) For aircraft without standby tail navigation lights, remove the main rear navigation light assemblies as follows (Figure 403): EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-43-05 Page 8 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Remove the screws (7) and washers (6) that attach both lens retainer (5) and lamp holder (1) to the light support. (b) Remove the lens retainer (5) and the lens (4). (c) Hold the lamp holder (1), then carefully push the lamp (3) and turn it counterclockwise to remove it. (d) Remove the lamp (3). (e) Pull out the lamp holder (1), remove the gasket (2) and disconnect the electrical connector (8). (f) Remove the lamp holder (1). (g) Install the protective cap on the disconnected electrical connector. (2) For aircraft with standby tail navigation lights, remove the main/standby rear navigation light assemblies as follows (Figure 404) (Figure 405): (a) Loosen the nuts (3) and washers (2) that attach the light support (1) to the tail boom. (b) Carefully pull out the light support (1) from the tail boom. (c) Remove the screws (11) and the washers (10) to disconnect the electrical wire (9) from the lamp holder (7). (d) Loosen the screws (6) and nuts (8) that attach both deflector (4) and lamp holder (7) to the light support (1). (e) Remove the deflector (4). (f) Hold the lamp holder (7), then carefully push the lamp (5) and turn it counterclockwise remove it. (g) Remove the lamp (5) and the lamp holder (7). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-43-05 Page 9 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITHOUT STANDBY TAIL NAVIGATION LIGHT ASSEMBLIES Main Rear Navigation Light Assemblies - Removal/Installation Figure 403 A ZONE 321 DET. A B LIGHT SUPPORT (REF.) 8. CONNECTOR 1. LAMP HOLDER 2. GASKET 3. LAMP 4. LENS 5. LENS RETAINER 6. WASHER (2) DET. B 7. SCREW (2) SK145AMM330005A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-43-05 Page 10 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH STANDBY TAIL NAVIGATION LIGHT ASSEMBLIES AND/OR PRE- MOD SB145-55-0030 Main/Standby Rear Navigation Light Assemblies - Removal/Installation Figure 404 A ZONE 321 DET. A B TAIL BOOM 10. WASHER (2) 9. ELECTRICAL 11. SCREW (2) WIRE (2) 1. LIGHT SUPPORT 2. WASHER (3) 3. NUT (3) 4. DEFLECTOR 8. NUT (2) 7. LAMP HOLDER 5. LAMP DET. B 6. SCREW(2) SK145AMM330006A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-43-05 Page 11 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH STANDBY TAIL NAVIGATION LIGHT ASSEMBLIES AND/OR POST-MOD SB145-55-0030 Main/Standby Rear Navigation Light Assemblies - Removal/Installation Figure 405 A ZONE 321 DET. A B TAIL BOOM 10. WASHER (2) 9. ELECTRICAL 11. SCREW (2) WIRE (2) 1. LIGHT SUPPORT 2. WASHER (3) 3. NUT (3) 4. DEFLECTOR 8. NUT (2) 7. LAMP HOLDER 5. LAMP DET. B 6. SCREW(2) EM145AMM330964A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 33-43-05 Page 12 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-43-05-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 5. MAIN/STANDBY REAR NAVIGATION LIGHT ASSEMBLIES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the main/standby rear navigation light assemblies. (2) The main/standby rear navigation light assemblies are installed in the tail boom. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-43-00-700-801-A/500 NAVIGATION LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 55-36-01-400-801-A/400 TAIL-BOOM LIGHT LENS - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Tail boom I. Installation (Figure 403) (Figure 404) (Figure 405) SUBTASK 420-003-A CAUTION: DO NOT TOUCH THE LAMP DIRECTLY WITH FINGER TIP. THIS WILL DAMAGE THE LAMP. REMOVE GREASE OR FINGERPRINTS WITH A CLEANING CLOTH SOAKED IN CORRECT DEGREASER. (1) For aircraft without standby tail navigation lights, install main rear navigation light assemblies as follows (Figure 403): (a) Remove the protective cap from the electrical connector. (b) Connect the electrical connector (8) to the lamp holder (1) and install the gasket (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-43-05 Page 13 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (c) Hold the lamp holder (1), and carefully push the lamp (3) and turn it clockwise to lock it. (d) Put the lamp holder (1), the lens (4) and the lens retainer (5) on their installation position in the light support. (e) Install the washers (6) and tighten the screws (7) that attach both lens retainer (5) and lamp holder (1) to the light support. (2) For aircraft with standby tail navigation lights, install main/standby rear navigation light assemblies as follows (Figure 404) (Figure 405): (a) Hold the lamp holder (7) on its installation position and carefully push the lamp (5) and turn it clockwise to lock it. (b) Put the the lamp holder (7) and the deflector (4) on their installation position in the light support (1). (c) Install the screws (6) and nuts (8) that attach both lamp holder (7) and deflector (4) to the light support (1). (d) Install the washers (10) and tighten the screws (11) that attach the electrical wires (9) to the lamp holder (7). (e) Put the light support (1) on its installation position in the tail boom. (f) Install the washers (2) and tighten the nuts (3) that attach the light support (1) to the tail boom. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Remove the DO-NOT-OPERATE tag from the NAV switch. (2) Do the operational test of the main/standby rear navigation lights installed ( AMM TASK 33-43-00-700-801-A/500). (3) Install the tail-boom light lens ( AMM TASK 55-36-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 33-43-05 Page 14 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
